Miscellaneous Highlights: The game between the Cleveland Guardians and Houston Astros on September 29, 2024, was canceled due to inclement weather.
José Ramírez was denied the opportunity to become Cleveland’s first 40/40/40 hitter due to the game cancellation.
The next game for the Cleveland Guardians will be on October 5 in Game 1 of the American League Division Series.
The Houston Astros must advance past Detroit in the AL Wild Card series to potentially face the Guardians again.
Managers from both clubs and MLB officials decided to cancel the game after a three-hour delay due to safety concerns.
Ticketholders for the canceled game will receive a credit amount for their tickets that can be used towards a 2024 postseason game or a 2025 regular season game.
